alert.note: Alert for Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN MIDDLESEX AND NEW HAVEN COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Middlebury to near New Haven. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Haven and Waterbury around 520 PM EDT. Meriden and North Branford around 525 PM EDT. Guilford and Durham around 530 PM EDT. Middletown and Middlefield around 535 PM EDT. Cromwell around 540 PM EDT. Portland and Haddam around 545 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southern Connecticut.

area.areaDesc: Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Southern New Haven
